info.title: Gateway API Specification
info.description: This is an API specification that allows devices to upload data to GET Cloud and obtain existing information on GET Cloud.

requestBody.description: The structure of this endpoint always consists of an array of "events", each of which element consists of index, timestamp, type, and values. The structure of values depends on the event type. For instance, in the alarm event, each array element in values contains code and active. In the parameterChanged event, each array element in values contains index, oldValue, and newValue. See "schema" for more info.

requestBody.description: See the Schema section to see the set of valid cycle log fields. This log always comes in pairs (two rows) from the device, charging row and discharging row. Instead of sending as two separate rows, this log sends one row for each pair. The index, cycle number, and cycle logs are always in the form of int32 array with two elements.

items.description:
The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `127` - Array of active alarm codes [activeAlarms]
  * `129` - The name of the charging algorithm [algorithmName]
  * `130` - The version of the charging algorithm, can be NULL [algorithmVersion]
  * `133` - The start time of discharge in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.mmm±hhmm format. Popnet source is in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [dischargeTimeStart]
  * `138` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering the discharge state. [dischargeVpcStart]
  * `139` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering charge state. [dischargeVpcEnd]
  * `140` - Minimum battery voltage per cell during discharge. [dischargeVpcMin]
  * `141` - State of charge at start of discharge. [dischargeStateOfChargeStart]
  * `142` - State of charge at end of discharge. [dischargeStateOfChargeEnd]
  * `143` - Battery temperature at discharge start time. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureStart]
  * `144` - Battery temperature at charge start time. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureEnd]
  * `145` - The maximum battery temperature being reached during discharge. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMax]
  * `146` - The minimum battery temperature being reached during discharge. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMin]
  * `147` - Number of Ah discharged between discharge start time and charge start time. [dischargeAh]
  * `148` - Number of Wh discharged between discharge start time and charge start time. [dischargeWh]
  * `149` - Ah discharged when current > 25 % of Battery capacity. [dischargeAhI25]
  * `150` - Discharge time when current > 25 % of Battery capacity. [dischargeTimeI25]
  * `151` - Ah discharged when 25% ≥ I > 15% of Battery capacity. [dischargeAhI15]
  * `152` - Discharge time when 25% ≥ I > 15 % of Battery capacity. [dischargeTimeI15]
  * `153` - Ah discharged when 15% ≥ I > 0% of Battery capacity [dischargeAhI0]
  * `154` - Discharge time when 15% ≥ I > 0 % of Battery capacity. [dischargeTimeI0]
  * `155` - Duration of current regeneration during discharge. [dischargeRegeneratingTime]
  * `156` - Number of Ah being regenerated between Discharge start time and Charge start time. [dischargeRegeneratedAh]
  * `157` - Number of Wh being regenerated between Discharge start time and Charge start time. [dischargeRegeneratedWh]
  * `159` - The maximum current during discharge. [dischargeCurrentMax]
  * `160` - Start datetime of charging in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.mmm±hhmm format. Popnet source is in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [chargeTimeStart]
  * `161` - End datetime of charging in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.mmm±hhmm format. Popnet source is in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [chargeTimeEnd]
  * `165` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering charge state. [chargeVpcStart]
  * `166` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering discharge state. [chargeVpcEnd]
  * `167` - Maximum voltage per cell during charge. [chargeVpcMax]
  * `168` - State of charge at start of charge. [chargeStateOfChargeStart]
  * `169` - State of charge at end of charge. [chargeStateOfChargeEnd]
  * `170` - Battery temperature at Charge start time. [chargeBatteryTemperatureStart]
  * `171` - Battery temperature at Charge end time. [chargeBatteryTemperatureEnd]
  * `172` - The maximum battery temperature being reached during charge. [chargeBatteryTemperatureMax]
  * `173` - The minimum battery temperature being reached during charge. [chargeBatteryTemperatureMin]
  * `174` - Ah charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeAh]
  * `175` - Wh charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeWh]
  * `176` - Ah charged when current > 25 % of capacity. [chargeAhI25]
  * `177` - Charge time when current > 25 % of capacity. [chargeTimeI25]
  * `178` - Ah charged when 25% ≥ I > 15% of capacity. [chargeAhI15]
  * `179` - Charge time when 25% ≥ I > 15 % of capacity. [chargeTimeI15]
  * `180` - Ah charged when 15% ≥ I > 0% of capacity. [chargeAhI0]
  * `181` - Charge time when 15% ≥ I > 0 % of capacity. [chargeTimeI0]
  * `182` - Total time in equalize charging phase. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is connected. [equalizeTime]
  * `183` - Ah being charged during equalize. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is used. [equalizeAh]
  * `184` - Wh being charged during equalize. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is used. [equalizeWh]
  * `186` - Maximum current measured during charge. [chargeCurrentMax]
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `220` - Array of device status [deviceStatus]
  * `24` - Current drained from the battery during charging. [baseLoad]
  * `25` - Resistance in the cables between charger and battery. [cableResistance]
  * `26` - Charging algorithm identifier. [algorithmNumber]
  * `5` - Number of cells of the battery [cells]
  * `6` - Capacity in Ah of the battery [capacity]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `127` [activeAlarms] - INT32[] [0 - 231]
  * `129` [algorithmName] - STRING [∞ - ∞]
  * `130` [algorithmVersion] - INT32 [0 - ∞]
  * `133` [dischargeTimeStart] - DATETIME [0 - ∞])
  * `138` [dischargeVpcStart] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `139` [dischargeVpcEnd] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `140` [dischargeVpcMin] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `141` [dischargeStateOfChargeStart] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `142` [dischargeStateOfChargeEnd] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `143` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureStart] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `144` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureEnd] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `145` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMax] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `146` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMin] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `147` [dischargeAh] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `148` [dischargeWh] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `149` [dischargeAhI25] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `150` [dischargeTimeI25] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `151` [dischargeAhI15] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `152` [dischargeTimeI15] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `153` [dischargeAhI0] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `154` [dischargeTimeI0] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `155` [dischargeRegeneratingTime] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `156` [dischargeRegeneratedAh] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `157` [dischargeRegeneratedWh] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `159` [dischargeCurrentMax] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞])
  * `160` [chargeTimeStart] - DATETIME [0 - ∞])
  * `161` [chargeTimeEnd] - DATETIME [0 - ∞])
  * `165` [chargeVpcStart] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `166` [chargeVpcEnd] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `167` [chargeVpcMax] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `168` [chargeStateOfChargeStart] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `169` [chargeStateOfChargeEnd] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `170` [chargeBatteryTemperatureStart] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `171` [chargeBatteryTemperatureEnd] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `172` [chargeBatteryTemperatureMax] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `173` [chargeBatteryTemperatureMin] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `174` [chargeAh] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `175` [chargeWh] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `176` [chargeAhI25] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `177` [chargeTimeI25] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `178` [chargeAhI15] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `179` [chargeTimeI15] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `180` [chargeAhI0] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `181` [chargeTimeI0] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `182` [equalizeTime] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `183` [equalizeAh] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `184` [equalizeWh] - INT32 [0 - ∞])
  * `186` [chargeCurrentMax] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.1)
  * `187` [index] - INT32 [0 - ∞]
  * `220` [deviceStatus] - INT32[] [0 - 74]
  * `24` [baseLoad] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.001)
  * `25` [cableResistance] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.001)
  * `26` [algorithmNumber] - INT32 [0 - 65535]
  * `5` [cells] - INT32 [0 - ∞]
  * `6` [capacity] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞])

The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `1` - Device numerical identification, configurable. [deviceID]
  * `118` - Charged Ah in % of total capacity in main stage [chargeAhP]
  * `119` - Forklift ID [forkLiftId]
  * `120` - Battery serial number [batterySerialNumber]
  * `121` -  [reserved]
  * `123` - The mode that charger will use to charge the battery [chargingMode]
  * `127` - Array of active alarm codes [activeAlarms]
  * `129` - The name of the charging algorithm [algorithmName]
  * `160` - Start datetime of charging in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.mmm±hhmm format. Popnet source is in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [chargeTimeStart]
  * `161` - End datetime of charging in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.mmm±hhmm format. Popnet source is in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [chargeTimeEnd]
  * `165` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering charge state. [chargeVpcStart]
  * `166` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering discharge state. [chargeVpcEnd]
  * `174` - Ah charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeAh]
  * `175` - Wh charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeWh]
  * `182` - Total time in equalize charging phase. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is connected. [equalizeTime]
  * `183` - Ah being charged during equalize. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is used. [equalizeAh]
  * `184` - Wh being charged during equalize. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is used. [equalizeWh]
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `2` - Type of battery [batteryType]
  * `203` - Charger temperature when battery connected before start of charging. [chargerTemperatureStart]
  * `204` - Charger temperature when battery disconnected. [chargerTemperatureEnd]
  * `205` - Maximum charger temperature between charge start time and charge end time. [chargerTemperatureMax]
  * `207` - Event log index at start of charge [eventIndexStart]
  * `208` - Event log index at end of charge [eventIndexEnd]
  * `210` - Time when charger ouput power is turned on. [chargeTime]
  * `220` - Array of device status [deviceStatus]
  * `24` - Current drained from the battery during charging. [baseLoad]
  * `25` - Resistance in the cables between charger and battery. [cableResistance]
  * `26` - Charging algorithm identifier. [algorithmNumber]
  * `389` - Serial number of the device, 8 bytes. MP serial numbers are 5 bytes. [notavailable]
  * `416` - Max power during charge. [LogPeakPower]
  * `417` - Consumed mains power. [LogConsumedKWh]
  * `5` - Number of cells of the battery [cells]
  * `50` - Calculated actual battery capacity. [actualCapacity]

items.description:
The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `191` - The time when log was written, in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.mmm±hhmm format. Popnet source is in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [time]
  * `192` - Average current between two instant log samples.  [currentAverage]
  * `193` - Minimum current between two instant log samples. [currentMin]
  * `194` - Maximum current between two instant log samples. [currentMax]
  * `195` - Average battery voltage between two instant log samples.  [voltageAverage]
  * `196` - Minimum voltage between two instant log samples. [voltageMin]
  * `197` - Maximum voltage between two instant log samples. [voltageMax]
  * `198` - Average battery temperature between two instant log samples.  [temperatureAverage]
  * `199` - Minimum battery temperature between two instant log samples. [temperatureMin]
  * `200` - Maximum battery temperature between two instant log samples. [temperatureMax]
  * `201` - Average battery state of charge between two instant log samples (BMU2 only) [stateOfCharge]
  * `202` - Average center voltage between two instant log samples. [middleVoltageAverage]
  * `9` - The amount of seconds between instant logs, 0 = off [instantLogPeriod]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `187` [index] - INT32 [0 - ∞]
  * `191` [time] - DATETIME [0 - ∞])
  * `192` [currentAverage] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `193` [currentMin] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `194` [currentMax] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `195` [voltageAverage] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `196` [voltageMin] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `197` [voltageMax] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `198` [temperatureAverage] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞])
  * `199` [temperatureMin] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞])
  * `200` [temperatureMax] - DOUBLE [∞ - ∞])
  * `201` [stateOfCharge] - INT32 [0 - 100])
  * `202` [middleVoltageAverage] - DOUBLE [0 - ∞] (divided by 0.01)
  * `9` [instantLogPeriod] - INT32 [∞ - ∞]

The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `127` - Array of active alarm codes [activeAlarms]
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `191` - The time when log was written, in YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.mmm±hhmm format. Popnet source is in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [time]
  * `88` - Momentary charger heat sink temperature. [chargerTemperature]
  * `9` - The amount of seconds between instant logs, 0 = off [instantLogPeriod]
  * `90` - Momentary charger measured current. [chargerCurrent]
  * `91` - Momentary charger measured voltage. [chargerVoltage]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
